claimsprovis: Legal Actions â€“ no action at law can be taken after 6 years in Alabama.

premiums: Must provide 45 days notice in advance of a rate increase.

definitions: Definition of 'Sickness' must provide coverage for complications of pregnancy on the same basis as any other sickness or injury.

claimsprovis: Deleted discretionary authority language.
requirednotices:
Information Notice (LRS-8446-0320): This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s).  It discloses the name, address & telephone number of the soliciting agent; the name, address and telephone number of the field office providing service to the policyholder; and the address and telephone number of the Arkansas Insurance Department.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8709-0321): This form must be attached to the policy.  It explains the general functions of the Arkansas Life and Disability Insurance Guaranty Association Act.

definitions:
1. Active at Work definition revised to refer to the Insured's Usual Job.
2. There are two definitions of Disability, one used when Partial or Residual Disability Benefit is included, the other used when no Partial or Residual applies
3. Injury definition revised to just refer to bodily harm. Deleted reference in 'independent of all other causes'.
4. Definition of 'Sickness' must provide coverage of pregnancy on the same basis as any other sickness or injury.
5. Regular Care definition revised to refer to treatment administered as frequently as medically required to manage and care for the injury or sickness causing the disability.
6. Added definition of 'Substantial and Material Acts'.
7. Treatment definition revised, refers to care needed to prevent deterioration of the Insured's condition.
claimsprovis: Last paragraph of PAYMENT OF CLAIMS provision is amended to remove statement that decisions made by the claims review fiduciary are complete, final and binding on all parties.
weeklyincomeins: If 24 hour coverage, a paragraph was added under Exclusions stating that the Insured is required to apply for Workers Compensation if there is a reasonable belief that a sickness or injury is related to the job.
preexcondlimit: Pre-existing Condition provision reworded. The condition must cause or substantially contribute to the disability.
xferofcoverage: 2nd paragraph, the following conditions and items (1) through (3) are deleted in its entirety.
partialdisabene:
1. California's 'Partial Disability Benefit' is actually our Residual Disability Benefit.
2. Under 'Other Sources', deleted references to 'eligible to receive'; the benefits must be received in order to be offset against.
residdisabene:
1. California's 'Residual Disability Benefit' is actually our Partial Disability Benefit.
2. Under 'Other Sources', deleted references to 'eligible to receive'; the benefits must be received in order to be offset against.

Complaint Notice (LRS-8630-1215): This notice must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It provides information on how the policyholder/insured can make an inquiry with the Company or file a complaint with the Department.

definitions: Pregnancy must be treated the same as any other illness.
weeklyincomeins: Under 'Exclusions', 'while sane' was added to the exclusion for self-inflicted injuries.

scheduleofbene: Louisiana does not allow a benefit to be paid to anyone other than the insured.
definitions: Under 'Disabled', item (2) revised to refer to the Insured performing an occupation, which provides substantially the same earning capacity as his/her regular occupation.
genprovis: A policyholder must be given at least 60 days written notice prior to the cancellation or non-renewal of a policy.  This requirement does not apply to cancellation due to non-payment of premium.
claimsprovis:
(1) Must pay claims within 30 days.
(2) Under 'Legal Actions', references to other statesâ€™ time periods were deleted.
premiums: Premium rates cannot be increased during the initial 12 months of coverage and not more than once in any 6-month period following the initial 12-month period.  This limitation does not apply to increases due to the addition of new insureds, a change in age or geographic location or an increase in a benefit level.  In addition, written notice must be given to the policyholder of any premium increase of 20% or more at least 45 days prior to the effective date of the increase.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8720-0814):  This form must be attached to the policy. It explains the general functions of the Louisiana Life and Health Guaranty Association Act.

definitions:
The following Definition of Disability change will only be used if the max duration is 52 weeks or more. Language will be added by Contracts.

'Disabled means the Insured is:
unable to perform the substantial and material duties of his regular occupation for the first 12 months.  After that time, 'Disabled' means the Insuredâ€™s inability to perform the substantial and material duties of any occupation.  Any occupation shall be one for which the Insured is qualified by reason of education, training or experience.

The following Definition of Disability change applies if maximum duration is under 52 weeks:

(1) unable to perform the substantial and 
            material duties of his/her regular    
             occupation; and 
(2) under the regular care of a physician

genprovis: The CHANGES TO POLICY provision in the Policy has been revised to require that all amendments must be signed by the policyholder.
claimsprovis:
1. CLAIMS FORMS section was revised to state that the claimant must receive claim forms within 15 days after we receive notice of claim.

2. The WRITTEN PROOF OF LOSS provision was revised to require written proof of loss within 30 days after the beginning of the period for which we are liable.  Also, the last paragraph requires proof of loss to be provided as soon as reasonably possible, rather than within 1 year.

3. The PAYMENT OF CLAIMS provision was revised to indicate that once we receive writ-ten proof of loss, benefits will be paid for loss of time within 30 days.  Any unpaid balance remaining at the end of a period of liability will be paid immediately. Deleted discretionary authority language.

1. EXCLUSIONS: deleted the exclusion for a period of disability while the Insured is con-fined in a penal/correctional facility; can only exclude for a disability caused/contributed by an Injury or Sickness that occurs while the Insured is confined in a penal/correctional facility following con-viction of a crime.

2. OTHER INCOME BENEFITS: item 8 (b) revised to refer to an Insured's dependents for whom the Insured has a legal obligation to provide for their financial support.

preexcondlimit:
Pre-existing Conditions: 
Cannot use a 24 month time period unless a 12 month treatment free period applies.
preexcondlimitvps: Pre-existing Conditions: Cannot use a 24 month time period unless a 12 month treatment free period applies.
requirednotices: Rhode Island Guaranty Association notice (LRS-9219 Ed. 0110) must be attached to the policy.

genprovis:
1. Clerical Error section added to certificate.

2.  Item 4 was added to the TERMINATION OF THE POLICY provision to include an-other possible termination date, as follows:

'(4)  any Policy Anniversary'
claimsprovis:
1.  The WRITTEN PROOF OF LOSS pro-vision was changed to provide us with the right to require subsequent proof of the continuance of any disability as reasonably necessary.

2.  The rewritten PAYMENT OF CLAIMS provisions requires the payment of claims within 60 days after we receive written proof of loss.

The Facility of Payment language was re-written to provide up to $5,000 in the event the Insured dies before all benefits have been paid, rather than the standard $1,000.

3.  The PHYSICAL EXAMINATION AND AUTOPSY provision has been rewritten to provide that an autopsy can only be made during a period of contestability, unless prohibited by law, and that such autopsy must be performed in South Carolina.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9624-0221):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the South Carolina Life and Health Guaranty Association Act.

definitions: Definition of â€˜â€™Physician' following text added: This exclusion does not apply in those areas in which the immediate family member is the only physician in the area and acting within the scope of their normal employment.
claimsprovis: Last paragraph of PAYMENT OF CLAIMS provision is amended to remove statement that decisions made by the claims review fiduciary are complete, final and binding on all parties.
weeklyincomeins:
Under the EXCLUSIONS section:

1.  The Exclusion for any sickness or injury which occurs out of or in the course of work for wage or profit was removed.

2.  Exclusions and offsets for benefits under Workers Comp or other workersâ€™ disability law must be paid to the insured in order to offset or exclude.

Exclusion (4) was rewritten as follows:

requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8571-0513):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the South Dakota Life and Health Guaranty Association Act.
additionalnotes: South Dakota requires that benefits be payable for at least 12 weeks if an Insured is disabled.

definitions:

Item (1) under the 'OTHER SOURCES' section is replaced by the following:

â€˜â€™(1) Disability income benefits [an Insured][you are] eligible to receive under any franchise or group insurance plan(s) provided by [you (the Group Policyholder)] [the Policyholder];'
requirednotices:
Information Notice (LRS-8464-1192):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s).  It discloses the name, address and telephone number of the policyholder service office.  If there are any changes in this policyholder service information, we must provide notice of the change prior to its effective date.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8580-0610):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the Tennessee Life and Health Guaranty Association Act.

facepage:
The following notice must appear on the face page of the policy and certificate(s):

'THIS IS NOT A POLICY OF WORKERSâ€™ COMPENSATION INSURANCE. THE EMPLOYER DOES NOT BECOME A SUBSCRIBER TO THE WORKERSâ€™ COMPENSATION SYSTEM BY PURCHASING THIS POLICY, AND IF THE EMPLOYER IS A NON-SUBSCRIBER, THE EMPLOYER LOSES THOSE BENEFITS WHICH WOULD OTHERWISE ACCRUE UNDER THE WORKERSâ€™ COMPENSATION LAWS.  THE EMPLOYEE MUST COMPLY WITH THE WORKERSâ€™ COMPENSATION LAW AS IT PERTAINS TO NON-SUBSCRIBERS AND THE REQUIRED NOTIFICATIONS THAT MUST BE FILED AND POSTED.'
premiums: 60 days notice in advance of a rate increase.
requirednotices:
Information Notice (LRS-8690-0320):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s) as either the first, second or third page.  It discloses toll-free telephone number and procedures for obtaining information and filing complaints.  This notice requirement is extraterritorial and applies to all certificates issued to Texas residents regardless of where the policy is sitused. 

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8785-0914):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the Texas Life, Accident, Health and Hospital Service Insurance Guarantee Association Act.

claimsprovis:
1. The WRITTEN PROOF OF LOSS provision was revised to remove the requirement that the Insured provide proof of loss within 1 year, unless legally unable to do so.

2. Last paragraph of PAYMENT OF CLAIMS provision is amended to remove the statement that decisions made by the claims review fiduciary are complete, final and binding on all parties.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8729-0710):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the Utah Life and Disability Guarantee Association Act.

scheduleofbene: Vermont requires that the benefit duration period be at least 26 weeks under policy number LRS-6451. This means that for VPS, the benefit duration must be at least 26 weeks. For STD, there is a separate policy for under 26 weeks.
definitions:
If part-time employees are covered, any employee working 17.5 hours or more per week is eligible.


Injury definition revised to delete the reference to being independent of all other causes.
genprovis: Clerical Error section; no time limit
claimsprovis: Discretionary authority language deleted.
weeklyincomeins:
Exclusions section revised. No exclusions for: self-inflicted injury while sane, penal/correctional facility stay; items such as sex change operations; in vitro fertilization.
  
Cosmetic surgery exclusion does not apply to reconstructive surgery following surgery from a trauma, infection or disease.

requirednotices:
State Notice (LRS-8426-0593): This Important Information Notice to Policyholders must be attached to the policy and the certificate(s).

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-9452-0115): This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the Virginia Life and Health Guaranty Association.

genprovis: Written notice of cancellation or non-renewal must be provided at least 60 days prior to the effective date.
requirednotices: Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8789-0709):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the West Virginia Life and Health Guarantee Association Act.

genprovis: Written notice of cancellation, non-renewal or renewal with altered terms must be provided at least 60 days prior to the effective date.
claimsprovis: Proof of Loss' - one year period starts after the initial 90 day period.
premiums: Written notice of a premium rate change must be provided at least 60 days prior to its effective date.
requirednotices: Informational Notice (LRS-8742-0295):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It notifies insured of the right to file a complaint with the Office of the Commissioner of Insurance.

Guaranty Association Notice (LRS-8645-0919):  This form must be attached to the policy and certificate(s). It explains the general functions and limitations of the Wyoming Life and Health Guaranty Association Act.
